etymology.description: semantic: 氵(水) (shuǐ, "water") + phonetic: 曷(曷) (hé, "dry") = dry or exhausted of water -> thirsty
etymology.interpretation: The character 渴(kě, "thirsty") combines the water radical 氵(水) to indicate the relation to water, with 曷(曷) (hé, "dry") as the phonetic component, suggesting dryness or a lack of water, which directly conveys the concept of thirst.

examples.chinese: 我感觉非常渴(我感覺非常渴)。
长时间运动后(長時間運動後)，他开始感到渴(他開始感到渴)。
examples.pinyin: Cháng shíjiān yùndòng hòu, tā kāishǐ gǎndào kě.
examples.english: After long exercise, he started to feel thirsty.

examples.chinese: 口渴时(口渴時)，喝一杯冰水很解乏(喝一杯冰水很解乏)。
examples.pinyin: Kǒu kě shí, hē yì bēi bīngshuǐ hěn jiěfá.
examples.english: When thirsty, drinking a glass of iced water is very refreshing.
